definitions: a smoothbore gun for firing small shot at short range.
shortDefinitions: smooth-bore gun for firing small shot at short range

definitions: the front passenger seat in a vehicle

examples.text: Katherine sits in shotgun and gives Maria directions
all the back benches in the shuttle were full when I arrived, so I took the shotgun seat

definitions: used to claim the right to sit in the front passenger seat of a vehicle on a particular journey

examples.text: ‘Shotgun!’ she yelled and tossed the keys to Veronica

definitions: an offensive formation in which the quarterback receives the snap while standing several yards behind the line of scrimmage.
shortDefinitions: offensive formation in which quarterback receives snap while standing several yards behind line of scrimmage

definitions: aimed at a wide range of things; having no specific target

examples.text: many companies use the shotgun approach, aiming advertising at the widest possible audience

shortDefinitions: aimed at wide range of things

definitions: denoting a long, narrow single-story house whose rooms are arranged one behind another

examples.text: his family lived in a shotgun shack in South Memphis

shortDefinitions: with rooms lined up one behind another, forming long narrow whole

definitions: shoot at or kill with a shotgun

examples.text: he had been shotgunned by drug dealers

shortDefinitions: shoot at or kill with shotgun

definitions: consume (a canned drink) in one go by puncturing the can, putting one’s mouth over the resulting hole, and then opening the can by means of the ring pull to produce a rapid flow
shortDefinitions: consume canned drink in one go through hole punctured in can
